summary: This is a cover email from Judge Alison J. Nathan's chambers transmitting a memorandum endorsement in the case United States v. Maxwell (20-cr-330) to be filed on the public docket. It indicates a procedural step in the legal proceedings against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The Honorable Judge whose chambers sent the email transmitting the memorandum endorsement in the case US v. Maxwell.

persons.name: Nathan NYSD Chambers
persons.context: The sender of the email, representing the chambers of Judge Alison J. Nathan.

persons.name: Laura Mennin
persons.context: A recipient (Cc) of the email transmitting the court document.

persons.name: Jeff Palliuca
persons.context: A recipient (Cc) of the email transmitting the court document.

connections.description: The chambers staff acts on behalf of and under the authority of Judge Nathan.
Judge Nathan's chambers is communicating a court order/document to Laura Mennin, likely an attorney or party in the case.
Judge Nathan's chambers is communicating a court order/document to Jeff Palliuca, likely an attorney or party in the case.

events.title: Filing of Memorandum Endorsement in US v. Maxwell
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan signs and her chambers transmits a memorandum endorsement to be filed on the public docket for case 20-cr-330.

keyFacts: The document is a procedural email from Judge Alison J. Nathan's chambers regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case (20-cr-330).
A memorandum endorsement was signed by Judge Nathan and was to be filed on the public docket on or about April 27, 2021.
The communication was sent to Laura Mennin and Jeff Palliuca, likely attorneys involved in the case.
The document itself is a cover note; the substantive legal ruling or order is contained in the attached PDF file (20cr330_Memo_Endorsement_4.27.21.pdf).
